newsitem.title: ISRAEL: Israel shares end higher in quiet trading.
newsitem.headline: Israel shares end higher in quiet trading.

text.p: Israeli shares closed higher on Monday in very quiet trading, with traders saying the market was awaiting fresh news.
The benchmark Mishtanim index of the top 100 shares rose 1.32 percent, or 3.21 points, to 245.64 on low all-share turnover of 76 million shekels against 53 million shekels on Sunday.
The Maof 25 blue chip index closed 1.53 percent higher at 253.98.

"Turnover was very low. Today's rise was meaningless. Many shares rose sharply on very low volume. The only positive thing is that there are no sellers in the market," said Amir Eyal of Epsilon Securities.
"It seems that the market wants to rise and investors are only awaiting fresh news to start buying," Eyal added.
"Fourth-quarter earnings reports were above expectations, which is a positive factor that needs to be reflected in share prices," added Michael Weiss of Evergreen Capital Markets.

Bank Leumi gained 0.75 percent to 535 agorot. The bank said fourth-quarter 1996 net profit rose to 164.9 million shekels from 90.3 million a year earlier. Leumi also said it would pay an aggregate dividend 650 million shekels to shareholders most of it coming from the forced sale of non-bank holdings last year.
IDB Development Corp rose 2.5 percent to 6,734 agorot. The company reported that net profit fell in the fourth-quarter of 1997 to 16 million shekels from 53 million shekels a year earlier.

Elco Holdings surged 5.0 percent to 2,326 agorot on volume of only 41,868 shekels. Elco reported a fourth-quarter net loss of 3.5 million shekels compared with a 14.4 million net profit of 14.4 million shekels a year ago.

The most active shares were Bank Hapoalim, which rose 2.75 percent to 661 agorot on volume of 5.5 million shekels; Koor Industries, which gained 2.75 percent to 30,849 agorot on turnover of 4.5 million shekels; and Teva Pharmaceutical Industries, which rose 0.5 percent to 18,850 agorot on volume of 4.3 million shekels.
